events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car at a busy intersection. They expressed urgency to resolve the matter quickly.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident as the event involves a car collision resulting in damage.
An insurance agent specializing in vehicle collisions was assigned to handle the claim to support the customer through the process.
The customer received official acknowledgment of their car accident claim and was informed about the next steps expected.
The agent requested additional documents, including photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including detailed images of their vehicle damage and official police report.
The claims department began investigating the accident details, including fault determination and damage assessment.
Investigation concluded with a clear report identifying liability as the other driverâ€™s responsibility.
A settlement offer was proposed covering full repair costs and a rental car reimbursement for the claim.
The policyholder confirmed satisfaction with the settlement proposal and expressed thanks for the efficient handling.
The claim was officially approved based on investigation outcomes and documented damage to the vehicle.
Insurance payment was issued directly to the vehicle repair shop to expedite the repair process for the customer.
The claim was closed successfully after all payments were made and the customer confirmed satisfaction with the repairs.
The finalized claim documents and investigation reports were archived for record-keeping and future reference.
